item.title: The Gang-Linked Prison Chief Taking Custody of Trump’s Deportees
item.description: Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele’s prison director was sanctioned by the U.S. for secret dealings with MS-13 leaders.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: Opinion | You Say You Want an Intifada Revolution
item.description: ‘Free Palestine,’ says a gunman after killing two outside a Jewish event.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Darkness on a Washington Street
item.description: The right answer to an act of terror: from Jews, pride; from America, justice.
item.dc:creator: Sahar Juliet Tartak

item.title: Israeli Embassy Staffers Gunned Down in D.C. Were Young, Ascendant and in Love
item.description: The two young professionals were known to those close to them as devoted to peace efforts.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: U.S. Considers Withdrawing Thousands of Troops From South Korea
item.description: The Trump administration is contemplating the redeployment of about 4,500 U.S. forces to Guam or other locations in the region.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Israeli Airstrike That Killed Top Hamas Leader in Gaza Hit Meeting of Top Militants
item.description: The strike targeting Mohammed Sinwar also killed several other high-ranking operatives, leaving a void in the group’s top leadership.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Taiwan’s Military Plans New Drone Units in Preparation for Potential China Invasion
item.description: Taiwan is racing to overhaul its military in preparation for what it sees as a potential invasion by China as soon as 2027.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: Opinion | A Realistic Path to Trump’s ‘Golden Dome’
item.description: The U.S. needs a stronger missile-defense system, but it won’t be easy and it will be expensive.
item.dc:creator: Michael O’Hanlon

item.title: European Officials Say Trump Tells Their Leaders Putin Isn’t Ready to End War
item.description: The White House disputes the account, saying the U.S. president believes Russia is winning in Ukraine but still wants peace.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Kim Jong Un’s New Warship Capsizes at Launch Due to ‘Absolute Carelessness’
item.description: The mishap is a major setback to the North Korean leader’s dream of modernizing his country’s outdated naval fleet.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Killing of Embassy Staffers Stokes Israeli Fears of Increasingly Hostile World
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he ordered security to be increased at Israeli missions around the world and for the state’s representatives following the attack.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: India’s Central Bank Cautiously Upbeat on Economy Despite Trade Risks
item.description: The bank says the country’s economy seems to be withstanding the risks posed by high trade and tariff-related uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Kimberley Kao

item.title: An Exhausted Israeli Public Turns Against War in Gaza
item.description: For over a year, Israelis were united in the war effort. Now, more are calling for an end to the fighting.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: The Fortress That China Built for Its Battle With America
item.description: Beijing is racing ahead in advanced technology, including in robots, satellites and AI—and in some cases is catching up with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: U.S., Canada Senior Officials Laud Productive Talks on the Sidelines of G-7
item.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Canadian Finance Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne met on the sidelines of the G-7 as the two countries try to tamp down trade tensions that have roiled the bilateral relationship for months.
item.dc:creator: Brian Schwartz

item.title: Opinion | Iran Holds Out for Nuclear Enrichment
item.description: It rails against Trump’s red line on uranium, which would block the path to a bomb.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Christian Refugees Deserve a Break
item.description: Letting them in is consistent with U.S. interests and Trump’s security priorities.
item.dc:creator: Luma Simms

item.title: Opinion | Pakistan’s Diplomatic Victory Conceals Its Weakness
item.description: Army chief Asim Munir emerged stronger—and with a promotion to field marshal—after confronting India. But his country has shown its weakness.
item.dc:creator: Sadanand Dhume

item.title: South African Leader Pushes Back on Trump’s ‘Genocide’ Claims in Tense Meeting
item.description: Cyril Ramaphosa is visiting the White House after relations with the U.S. deteriorated over race, Israel and trade.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Aid Deliveries Do Little to Alleviate Gaza Hunger Crisis
item.description: Ordinary Palestinians and international agencies say not enough food is getting into Gaza despite Israel allowing a limited amount of aid into the enclave.
item.dc:creator: Sudarsan Raghavan

item.title: Israeli Troops Fire Warning Shots Near Diplomats Touring West Bank
item.description: Israeli soldiers fired warning shots near diplomats from Europe, the Middle East and Asia who were touring the West Bank city of Jenin, prompting them to run for cover amid gunfire.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: EU Launches Antidumping Probe on Tires From China
item.description: The investigation follows an official complaint by the bloc’s tire industry claiming that Chinese imports are sold at unfair prices and are harming domestic producers.
item.dc:creator: Maitane Sardon

item.title: Nvidia’s Huang Calls U.S. Export Controls a Failure
item.description: Jensen Huang said limits on the sale of advanced chips to China had galvanized the country to push ahead faster with building its own AI technologies.
item.dc:creator: Liza Lin

item.title: Venezuela Frees U.S. Air Force Veteran in Overture to Trump
item.description: Caracas wants the U.S. president to allow oil companies to stay in the country. Nine Americans remain detained.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: ​U.S. Eased Syria Sanctions Over Fears of Imminent Collapse, Rubio Says
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned that Syria was potentially weeks away from a return to full-scale civil war, a scenario the U.S. was seeking to avert.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Netanyahu Confronts New Political Dilemma as Allies Push for End to Gaza War
item.description: Pressure from Israel’s allies to wrap up the war in Gaza presents the Israeli prime minister with a dilemma: end the conflict or plow on and sacrifice international support.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: To Combat China, U.S. Wants Its Friends to Do More
item.description: Washington’s allies are growing more amenable to collectively fighting Chinese aggression, though the new demands bring fresh challenges.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Zelensky’s Attempt to Get Trump on His Side Falls Flat
item.description: Ukraine’s leader has agreed to almost everything President Trump wants but Trump has put no pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Nvidia’s Jensen Huang Is Now a Geopolitical Superstar. It Comes With Risks.
item.description: Crowds and rock star-like excitement follow the charismatic CEO’s every step, but doing business in sensitive regions such as China and the Persian Gulf states brings its challenges.
item.dc:creator: Raffaele Huang

item.title: EU Moves Forward on Antitrust Cooperation With U.K.
item.description: The European Union and U.K. are finalizing a deal for both regions’ competition watchdogs to work together more closely on the back of a fresh trade and security agreement.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Inside the 36-Hour Push by Hostage Families to Meet With Trump and Qatar’s Emir
item.description: Former Israeli hostages and hostage family members rushed to Doha in a recent bid to capitalize on the president’s Middle East trip to push for the release of their relatives.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: The Tech Industry Is Huge—and Europe’s Share of It Is Very Small
item.description: A risk-averse business culture and complex regulations have stifled innovation on the continent, weighing on its future.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: Trump-Putin Call Yields No Breakthrough on Ukraine Cease-Fire
item.description: The leaders spoke by phone for more than two hours as the White House presses for a deal to end the fighting in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Alan Cullison

item.title: Netanyahu Says Israel Will Take Over Gaza as It Allows Food to Trickle Into Enclave
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that his country’s forces would take control of the entire Gaza Strip.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: U.K. and EU Strike Trade, Security Deal Years After Brexit
item.description: The agreement doesn’t undo Brexit but shows both sides have buried the hatchet after years of painful wrangling.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: EU-U.K. Deal Opens Door to British Arms Makers Accessing the Bloc’s Procurement Programs
item.description: The EU is drawing up plans to create new defense procurement loans worth $167.47 billion.
item.dc:creator: Cristina Gallardo

item.title: EU Lowers Growth Forecast as U.S. Tariffs Expected to Hit Exports
item.description: The European Commission warned a further rise in tariffs would inflict more damage on the bloc’s economy but also that increased spending on defense could lift activity.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Hamas Wanted to Torpedo Israel-Saudi Deal With Oct. 7 Attacks, Documents Reveal
item.description: The Israeli military says it recovered documents showing leaders of Hamas launched their deadly Oct. 7, 2023, attack on Israel with the aim of disrupting Israel’s normalization talks with Saudi Arabia.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Rebels in Captured City Force Residents to Clean Sewers and Morgues at Gunpoint
item.description: M23 insurgents backed by Rwanda are wielding their new authority harshly after taking over a city in eastern Congo.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Can a School Play Be a Threat to the State? Kenya’s Leaders Seem to Think So
item.description: President William Ruto and his former party chief have clashed over “Echoes of War” and its themes of a worsening generational divide.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Former Chinese Chip Boss Gets Suspended Death Sentence in Corruption Case
item.description: Zhao Weiguo is the former chairman of a once-highflying semiconductor firm that Beijing backed as part of a push to catch up with the West on technological capabilities.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Prime Minister Carney Says Canada Can Emerge As Energy Superpower
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he’s willing to amend federal rules that may pose headwinds toward getting energy projects built and capitalize on the country’s abundance of natural resources.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: José Mujica, Marxist Guerrilla Who Became Popular President of Uruguay, Dies at 89
item.description: The militant-turned-politician was an icon of the left in Latin America.
item.dc:creator: Juan Forero

item.title: British Police Investigate Fires at Properties Linked to Prime Minister
item.description: British counterterrorism police are probing a string of suspected arson attacks on two properties linked to Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: China Exults in Trump’s Tariff Pullback
item.description: The agreement was cheered in Beijing as vindication for Xi Jinping and his defiant response to President Trump’s trade war.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: China Is Building Megaports in South America to Feed Its Need for Crops
item.description: The trade war has heightened China’s need to develop gateways to import the continent’s soybeans, corn and other foodstuffs that are the only viable alternative supply to U.S. exports.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Trump Is Giving Refugee Status to White South Africans—but Many Don’t Want to Come
item.description: Relative wealth and generations of history dissuade many Afrikaners from claiming Trump’s offer; ‘This is my country.’
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: U.K. Plans to Tighten Rules After Record Influx of Migrants
item.description: Britain’s government said a record influx of foreigners since Brexit had done little to energize the economy.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: What to Watch During the U.S.-China Talks This Weekend
item.description: U.S. and Chinese officials began talks in Geneva on Saturday, setting the stage for a potential thawing of trade relations between the world’s two largest economies.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: China Struggles With Persistent Disinflationary Pressures as Tariffs Bite
item.description: The consumer-price index declined 0.1% from a year earlier in April, matching the fall seen the prior month and marking a third straight month of drops.

item.title: Who Joined Putin in Moscow to Celebrate Victory Day
item.description: More than 20 world leaders gathered in Red Square to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Key Player in Russian Oil Trading Hit by U.K. Sanctions
item.description: The U.K. sanctioned Etibar Eyyub, a vital figure in Russia’s oil trade, stepping up economic pressure on Moscow to strengthen Ukraine’s hand in peace negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Joe Wallace

item.title: Men Found Guilty of Felling Famous Tree in ‘Moronic Mission’ That Gripped U.K.
item.description: The pair’s destruction of the beloved Sycamore Gap tree stoked nationwide anger and a criminal investigation.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: Putin Parades China, North Korea Ties in Victory Day Show of Force
item.description: Moscow used a World War II commemoration to signal to Washington that Russia can be a helpful ally—or a fearsome foe.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: How Putin Keeps Russia’s Battle-Hardened Veterans on His Side
item.description: A growing crop of Russian soldiers have been tapped to fill a wave of government positions after serving in Ukraine, raising the prestige of military service and encouraging more people to enlist.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: BOE Set For Modest Rate Cuts As Inflation Stays High, NIESR Says
item.description: Inflation is likely to remain stubbornly high this year, the National Institute of Economic and Social Research said as it cut is 2025 growth forecast for the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: A Battlefield Death That Spelled the End for Russia’s Opposition
item.description: Ildar Dadin spent years arguing that nonviolent resistance was the best way to unseat Putin, until he took up arms against Russia.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: ‘Trump With a Pint’: How Nigel Farage Is Upending British Politics
item.description: The populist politician’s Reform UK party is soaring in the polls—and doing better at the ballot box—as voters lose patience with slow economic growth and high immigration.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: India Has a Golden Opportunity to Capture U.S. Business From China
item.description: The world’s most populous nation has long trailed not just China but also smaller countries with nimbler governments.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Attacks on Darfur Relief Camps Threaten Bloody New Chapter in War
item.description: Fears are growing that a rebel militia is using violence to consolidate control in the famine-stricken region of Sudan.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: When Will Gas Prices Go Down?
item.description: It’s too early to tell what effect the conflict in the Middle East might have
item.dc:creator: E. Napoletano

item.title: How to Get the Best Exchange Rates When You Travel
item.dc:creator: Jason Cochran

item.title: Best Travel Credit Cards for 2025
item.description: Our top picks should help you earn 2 to 3 flights with a few months’ spending.
item.dc:creator: Emily Sherman

item.title: Modi Positions India as Ally in Trump’s Illegal-Immigration Fight
item.description: India’s leader has supported the deportation of Indian citizens as New Delhi looks to safeguard U.S. relations and protect H-1B visas.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: This Indian Festival Hosts More Pilgrims Than the Population of the U.S.
item.description: At least 400 million people are estimated to have attended the event, believed to be at least two millennia old and now drawing to a close.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
